intro: Aconitum × bartokianum nothosubsp. bartokianum, commonly known as the Bartokianum hybrid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers in late summer, arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are compound, with deeply lobed segments, and the plant is known for its toxic alkaloids, which make it highly poisonous. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
